alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Garfield; Loup; Wheeler (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 4:38AM CST until January 19 at 6:00AM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills around 25 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM Thursday to 6 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM Thursday to noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong wind gusts Thursday may lead to areas of blowing snow from existing snow pack in addition to new snowfall.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Call Nebraska 5 1 1 for the latest road information.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Garfield; Loup; Wheeler
